TopicTitle: KSP crashes as soon as I launches it

Articles.Content:
Hi there everyone. I had just downloaded KSP and it seemed that it causes a access violation everytime I started KSP and there is now a crap load of crash reports in my KSP folder. Anyone knows what causes it? I really want to play on my 2nd computer ]

If you may ask, here's the report code for the first few lines of error.txt:

Unity Player [version: Unity 4.6.4f1\_99f88340878d]

KSP.exe caused an Access Violation (0xc0000005)

 in module KSP.exe at 001b:00000000.

Error occurred at 2015-06-05\_105002.

C:\Users\Admin\Desktop\Kerbal Space Program\KSP.exe, run by Admin.

32% memory in use.

2047 MB physical memory [1373 MB free].

4093 MB paging file [3326 MB free].

2048 MB user address space [1901 MB free].

Write to location 00000000 caused an access violation.

Context:

EDI: 0x00cc3488 ESI: 0x00cc3328 EAX: 0x00cc348c

EBX: 0x72333a89 ECX: 0x00b60480 EDX: 0x00b64c47

EIP: 0x00000000 EBP: 0x0018fb1c SegCs: 0x0000001b

EFlags: 0x00210246 ESP: 0x0018f9e4 SegSs: 0x00000023

Bytes at CS:EIP:

?? ?? ?? ?? ?? ?? ?? ?? ?? ?? ?? ?? ?? ?? ?? ??

The Output\_log 's lines is the following:

Initialize engine version: 4.6.4f1 (99f88340878d)

GfxDevice: creating device client; threaded=1

d3d: no support for this device type (accelerated/ref)

D3D9 initialization failed

GfxDevice: creating device client; threaded=1

d3d11: failed to create D3D11 device (0x887a0004)

D3D11 initialization failed

D3D9/D3D11 initialization failed, trying OpenGL

GfxDevice: creating device client; threaded=1

OpenGL:

 Version: OpenGL 1.1 [1.1.0]

 Renderer: GDI Generic

 Vendor: Microsoft Corporation

 Driver: RDPDD 6.1.7600.16385

 VRAM: 64 MB (via fallback)

 Extensions: GL\_WIN\_swap\_hint GL\_EXT\_bgra GL\_EXT\_paletted\_texture

Crash!!!

Much appreciated if anyone helps me! ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Hi YangQiming\_, most likely it's because you are running KSP from the desktop, as it's not an installed program it has no write permissions in the windows registry.

***Copy*** KSP to C:\Games and run that copy, you can make a shortcut on the desktop if you want.

Nope, it still crashes

- - - Updated - - -

It seemed something is wrong with KSP.exe

Didn't spot this before.

    GfxDevice: creating device client; threaded=1d3d: no support for this device type (accelerated/ref)D3D9 initialization failedGfxDevice: creating device client; threaded=1d3d11: failed to create D3D11 device (0x887a0004)D3D11 initialization failedD3D9/D3D11 initialization failed, trying OpenGLGfxDevice: creating device client; threaded=1OpenGL:Version: OpenGL 1.1 [1.1.0]Renderer: GDI GenericVendor: Microsoft CorporationDriver: RDPDD 6.1.7600.16385VRAM: 64 MB (via fallback)

You need to install drivers for your graphics card and reboot your PC.
